      • checkConnections

        protected void checkConnections()
        As some connections may timeout if left for a long period, we'll go through them all and make sure they all work if we detect any that have timed out. We may miss some since we are not locking the connections object, but we don't need to be 100%, and we don't want to freeze out everyone else while we're doing the check. at least we may get some. It is unlikely that all connections have a fault. We may also be checking some twice since other things can be pushing and popping, again, it's not perfect.

                         java.lang.String password)

        Specified by:
        checkUsernamePassword in class DBQuery
        Parameters:
        username - The username that the user has entered. Must return '-1' if username is equal to NULL.
        password - The password that the user has entered. Must return '-1' is password is equal to NULL.
        Returns:
        The userID of the user if the username and password are correct. Otherwise returns -1.

      • checkAuthToken

        public java.lang.Boolean checkAuthToken(long userID,
                               java.lang.String authToken)
        Description copied from class: DBQuery
        Checks if the auth token passed matches the auth token in the database for the given userID
        Specified by:
        checkAuthToken in class DBQuery
        Parameters:
        userID - The user to be checked
        authToken - The auth token we expect the user to have
        Returns:
        TRUE if the auth token passed matches the auth token in the database, FALSE otherwise. Returns FALSE if userID<1 or auth token is NULL.

      • logout

        public java.lang.Boolean logout(long userID)
        Description copied from class: DBQuery
        Logs a user out by setting the auth token in the database to NULL. As NULL is not an acceptable auth token to check against, no one can pretend to be the user without correctly logging back in and recreating the auth token with the correct username and password. To prevent other people logging a user out, the application code would want to check the user's userID/authToken match before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        logout in class DBQuery
        Parameters:
        userID - The user to be logged out
        Returns:
        TRUE if the user's authToken was set to NULL, false otherwise. Returns FALSE if the userID is less than 1.

      • updateAddress

        public java.lang.Boolean updateAddress(long id,
                              long userID,
                              java.lang.String street,
                              java.lang.String town,
                              java.lang.String zip,
                              int state,
                              java.lang.Boolean isDefault)
        Description copied from class: DBQuery
        Updates a user's address
        Specified by:
        updateAddress in class DBQuery
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the address to be updated
        userID - The userID of the user who lives at the address
        street - The new street
        town - The new town
        zip - The new zip code
        state - The new state
        isDefault - Whether the address is the user default address
        Returns:
        TRUE if the address is correctly updated, FALSE otherwise. FALSE if the address id and userID do now match i.e. they are trying to update someone else's address. FALSE if id, userID or state < 1. FALSE is other values are NULL

      • insertItemDB

        public long insertItemDB(long userID,
                java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String description,
                double startPrice,
                double reservePrice,
                double buyNowPrice,
                int quantity,
                java.util.Date endDate,
                long categoryID)
        Description copied from class: DBQuery
        Inserts an item in to the items table, typically an item sell. set's the thumbnail to be "blank.jpg" by default
        Specified by:
        insertItemDB in class DBQuery
        Parameters:
        userID - The user inserting the item
        name - The name of the item
        description - The description of the item
        startPrice - The items start price
        reservePrice - The items reserve price
        buyNowPrice - The items buy now price
        quantity - The number of items to be sold
        endDate - The date the auction ends
        categoryID - The category that the item is to be sold in
        Returns:
        The itemID number of the item inserted. If the item was not inserted then -1 is returned. -1 of the item name, description, endDate are null, or the userID or categoryID is less than 1 or if any of the prices are less than zero, or if the quantity is less than one

      • insertBidDB

        protected double insertBidDB(long userID,
                 long itemID,
                 int quantity,
                 double bid,
                 double maxBid)
        Description copied from class: DBQuery
        Inserts a user's bid for an item in to the database. It must also update the Item to inculde the new maxBid price that the user is willing to pay. We must ensure that there are no concurrency problems and that only one person is buy/bidding at a time on an item. Return -1.0 if user or item <1, or quantity<1 if bid<=0 or bid
        Specified by:
        insertBidDB in class DBQuery
        Parameters:
        userID - The user bidding
        itemID - The item they are bidding for
        quantity - The quantity of the item they want to buy
        bid - The current amount they are bidding
        maxBid - The maximum amount they will bid
        Returns:
        The current bid price if the bid was correctly inserted (the current item bid price, not just the user's bid). -1.0 if the bid was not inserted or userID or itemID < 1

      • buyItemNowDB

        protected java.lang.Boolean buyItemNowDB(long userID,
                             long itemID,
                             int quantity,
                             Account account,
                             Address address)
        Description copied from class: DBQuery
        Buys an item for a user. Checks the quantity is sufficient, inserts their payment, inserts that they have purchased the item, updates the items quantity, moves the item and bids to the old tables if the quantity is now zero (i.e. the auction has finished)
        Specified by:
        buyItemNowDB in class DBQuery
        Parameters:
        userID - The user buying the item
        itemID - The item the user is buying
        quantity - The quantity the user would like to buy
        account - The accountID that the user is paying with. Can be a new account with an id of less than 0 (i.e. an account we do not have on record)
        address - The address that they user is billing to.
        Returns:
        TRUE if the purchase was successful. FALSE if userID or itemID < 1, or if account or address is NULL, or if purchase was unsuccessful or item is not for buy now (buy now price=0.0)
